intro: Parietaria taiwania, commonly known as the Taiwan wallflower, is a flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes stinging nettles, and is characterized by its small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded areas and has heart-shaped leaves with a hairy texture. It is often found in forest understories and is adapted to humid, temperate climates. Parietaria taiwania is noted for its resilience and ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
